key_symptoms: Chills > Fever, no sweat, stiff neck, runny clear nose
deep_thinking_note: Do not use cooling herbs here. You must open the pores to sweat out the cold.

key_symptoms: Fever > Chills, sore throat, yellow phlegm
deep_thinking_note: Focus on the throat (LU10). Heat has entered the Wei Qi level.

key_symptoms: Barking cough, yellow sticky phlegm, chest tightness
pulse_tongue: Slippery-Rapid Pulse; Red Body/Yellow Greasy Coat
treatment_principle: Clear Heat; Resolve Phlegm; Descend Qi
deep_thinking_note: Use Dingchuan (Extra Point) alongside spine. Stop the wheeze first tonify later.

key_symptoms: Shortness of breath on exertion, weak voice, cold limbs
deep_thinking_note: The Kidney is failing to grasp the Qi down. Treat the root (Kidney).

key_symptoms: Dull burning pain, dry mouth, hunger but no desire to eat
deep_thinking_note: Avoid warming/drying herbs (like Ginger). The stomach lining is dry/atrophied.

key_symptoms: Pain triggers diarrhea, worse with stress/anger
deep_thinking_note: The Wood (Liver) is attacking the Earth (Spleen). Calm the mind to fix the gut.

key_symptoms: Dry pebble stools, dizziness, pale face
deep_thinking_note: Do not purge with laxatives; the boat (stool) cannot move because there is no water (blood) in the river.

key_symptoms: Dizziness, red face, anger, throbbing headache
deep_thinking_note: Bleed the ear apex (Erjian) for immediate pressure reduction.

key_symptoms: Dizziness, tinnitus, night sweats, weak knees
deep_thinking_note: This is the tired but wired patient. Anchoring is key.

key_symptoms: Fluttering heart, anxiety, insomnia, pale face
deep_thinking_note: The heart lacks fluid (blood) to house the Shen so the Shen floats (anxiety).

key_symptoms: Sighing, sensation of stuckness, mood swings
pulse_tongue: Wiry Pulse; Normal or Dusky Tongue
deep_thinking_note: The classic Four Gates treatment. The Qi just needs a reminder to flow.

key_symptoms: Easily startled, timid, waking up early
deep_thinking_note: Treat the Gallbladder to give the patient guts or courage.

key_symptoms: Waking frequently, night sweats, 5-palm heat
deep_thinking_note: The water (Yin) is not controlling the fire (Heart). Cool the engine.

key_symptoms: Sharp fixed pain, history of trauma/lifting
pulse_tongue: Wiry/Choppy Pulse; Purple spots on Tongue
deep_thinking_note: Do not use tonic points yet. You must clear the traffic jam (stasis) first.

key_symptoms: Dull ache, coldness, better with warmth/rubbing
deep_thinking_note: Moxa is mandatory here. The battery is low.

key_symptoms: Fixed pain, worse at night, aversion to cold
deep_thinking_note: Use ST38 (distal point) while the patient moves their arm.

key_symptoms: Unilateral throbbing, visual aura, nausea
deep_thinking_note: GB41 opens the Dai Mai (belt vessel) to drain excess from the head.

key_symptoms: Hemiplegia, facial droop, weakness
deep_thinking_note: Use high doses of Huang Qi (Astragalus) to push the blood through the stagnation.

key_symptoms: Pain before flow, clots, breast distension
deep_thinking_note: SP8 is the Xi-Cleft point for acute uterine pain.

key_symptoms: Hot flashes, night sweats, irritability
deep_thinking_note: Use The Triangle (KD3 KD6 SP6) to generate fluids.

key_symptoms: Cold uterus, low libido, frequent urination
deep_thinking_note: A Cold Womb cannot germinate a seed. Moxa on Zigong and CV4 is critical.

key_symptoms: Red weeping skin, intense itching, rapid onset
deep_thinking_note: Use the Four Bends (He-Sea points) to drain heat from the blood level.

key_symptoms: Red raised rashes that move around, itching
deep_thinking_note: Treat this like Wind in nature it moves quickly. Eliminate wind to stop the itch.

key_symptoms: Urinary urgency, burning, perineal pain
pulse_tongue: Slippery-Rapid Pulse; Yellow Greasy Coat on root
deep_thinking_note: LV5 (Luo point) circles the genitals. Essential for prostate issues.

key_symptoms: Gradual onset, tinnitus, knee weakness, premature aging
deep_thinking_note: The Five Seed Pill for reproduction. Focus on the Du Mai (Governor Vessel).

key_symptoms: Excessive thirst, hunger, urination (Xiao Ke)
deep_thinking_note: Include Weiwanxiashu (Pancreas hollow) extra point.

key_symptoms: Lethargy, feeling heavy, greasy skin, snoring
deep_thinking_note: ST40 is the Phlegm command point. You must resolve the dampness before tonifying.

key_symptoms: Sneezing, clear runny nose, dust sensitivity
deep_thinking_note: Jade Windscreen Powder builds the Shield (Wei Qi) against allergens.

key_symptoms: Room spinning, nausea, heavy head
pharmacopeia: Ban Xia Bai Zhu Tian Ma Tang
deep_thinking_note: The clear Yang cannot rise to the head because Phlegm is blocking the neck/throat.

key_symptoms: Fatigue, weight gain, cold intolerance, depression
deep_thinking_note: Need to ignite the Life Gate (Mingmen) fire to speed up metabolism.

key_symptoms: Nightmares, flashbacks, hyper-vigilance
deep_thinking_note: Trauma causes Blood Stasis in the Heart. You must move the blood to free the Spirit.

key_symptoms: Constant high ringing like a whistle, worsens with fatigue
deep_thinking_note: High pitch usually indicates Deficiency (Empty). Low roar indicates Excess.

key_symptoms: Loud rushing sound, acute onset, angry
deep_thinking_note: Treat aggressively to drain the Excess. Do not tonify.

key_symptoms: Pain down side of leg to ankle
deep_thinking_note: Use heavy stimulation at GB30 (Huantiao) to jump the Qi down the leg.

key_symptoms: Lateral elbow pain, weakness in grip
deep_thinking_note: Moxa on LI10/LI11 is often superior to needles for chronic tendonitis.

key_symptoms: Cravings, irritability, cough
pharmacopeia: Chai Hu Jia Long Gu Mu Li Tang
deep_thinking_note: Tim-Mee is a specific empirical point for nicotine withdrawal.

key_symptoms: Deep sleep, clear urine, cold limbs
deep_thinking_note: The Stream Shutting Pill. The Kidney Qi is not strong enough to wake the brain.

key_symptoms: Screaming in sleep, thrashing, hot hands
deep_thinking_note: Liver Heat disturbs the Hun (Ethereal Soul) at night.

key_symptoms: Sudden swelling of face/eyes, chills
deep_thinking_note: Open the lid (Lungs) to let the water drain out the bottom.

key_symptoms: Pitting edema in ankles/legs, cold back
deep_thinking_note: The water pump (Kidney Yang) is broken. Need warmth.

key_symptoms: Swollen hot joints, wandering pain
treatment_principle: Clear Heat; Expel Damp; Unblock Collaterals
pharmacopeia: Gui Zhi Shao Yao Zhi Mu Tang
deep_thinking_note: Heat Bi requires cooling herbs like Gypsum (Shi Gao) and Zhi Mu.

key_symptoms: Forgetfulness, dizziness, empty feeling in head
deep_thinking_note: The Brain is the Sea of Marrow. Only Kidney Essence can refill it.

key_symptoms: Straining, exhausting defecation, dry stool
deep_thinking_note: Elderly constipation is rarely excess. It is usually dryness/weakness.

key_symptoms: Red papules on forehead/nose, oily skin
deep_thinking_note: Forehead belongs to Fire/Lung. Clear heat from the upper burner.

key_symptoms: Cystic acne on jawline, worse with stress/period
deep_thinking_note: Jawline represents the Lower Jiao/Hormones. Regulate the Liver.

key_symptoms: High fever, profuse sweat, thirst, collapse
deep_thinking_note: Emergency condition. Clear heat immediately. PC3/BL40 bleed.

key_symptoms: Loss of consciousness, cold sweat, minute pulse
deep_thinking_note: GV26 (Philtrum) is the restart button. KI1 descends the rebellion.

key_symptoms: Sour regurgitation, burning, rib pain
deep_thinking_note: The Left Metal Pill specifically treats Liver Fire burning the Stomach.

key_symptoms: Exhaustion, heavy limbs, loose stools, brain fog
deep_thinking_note: You must lift the Qi to the head (GV20) and strengthen the gut (ST36).

key_symptoms: Snoring, gasping, obesity, purple tongue
pharmacopeia: Wen Dan Tang + Xue Fu Zhu Yu Tang
deep_thinking_note: Treat the throat as a phlegm obstruction combined with blood stasis from hypoxia.
